playn.core
Interface Storage

public interface Storage

Storage interface. This interface can be used to store settings and user data in a key/value String pair. This will attempt to store persistently, but will fall back to an in-memory Map. Use isPersisted() to check if the data is being persisted.

Method Summary
 String getItem(String key)
          Returns the item in the Storage associated with the specified key.
 boolean isPersisted()
          Returns true if the Storage data will be persistent across restarts.
 Iterable<String> keys()
          Returns an object that can be used to iterate over all storage keys.
 void removeItem(String key)
          Removes the item in the Storage associated with the specified key.
 void setItem(String key, String data)
          Sets the value in the Storage associated with the specified key to the specified data.
 

Method Detail

setItem

void setItem(String key,
             String data)
             throws RuntimeException
Sets the value in the Storage associated with the specified key to the specified data.

Parameters:
key - the key to a value in the Storage
data - the value associated with the key
Throws:
RuntimeException

removeItem

void removeItem(String key)
Removes the item in the Storage associated with the specified key.

Parameters:
key - the key to a value in the Storage

getItem

String getItem(String key)
Returns the item in the Storage associated with the specified key.

Parameters:
key - the key to a value in the Storage
Returns:
the value associated with the given key

keys

Iterable<String> keys()
Returns an object that can be used to iterate over all storage keys. Note: changes made to storage while iterating over the keys will not be reflected in the iteration, nor will they conflict with it.

isPersisted

boolean isPersisted()
Returns true if the Storage data will be persistent across restarts.
